Action.AddIRCMessage: @#PLAYERNAME# Great job Captain, we dealt with the other two as well
Got them pretty fast. Our tech guys will analize netcfgx.dll files of these fools and we will get all kind of information about their online activity
And even their physical location of last Internet connection!
Is this possible by just 1 analysis of a single file?
It is, but with help of all ISPs of California and one special benefactor
Benefactor? And who would be that?
EnTech company
They got government support recently and provided their High-End programs to different Police Departments of USA
Including EnSec and Hacknet_OS, that we are using right now
So that we can be more effective against hackers, and they couldn't fight back easily as well
It even protects our infrastructure if someone of us gone rogue, for some reason
Well, this OS is really promissing, but it can cause a lot of damage to anyone who is not protected with EnSec
Kind of monopolistic, isn't it?
Yeah, but if they passed all antitrust commissions somehow, that means their actions are within antitrust law
I think all we need to know, is that we don't let the bad guys having this stuff and making sure nobody is using this software against non-crimuinal elements
Agreed
Let's then focus on our job now
Captain, I have done the document filing and I have a new report
What is it?
Someone attacked San-Francisco's Medical Archive server!
Okay boys and a girl, we have some work to do!
@channel I uploaded report to the server
Got it, let's wait a little, and most probably we can get admin access to the whitelist server
How is that possible?
I recognize that particular whitelist program, it has a few vulnerabilities
Interesting
Yep, it worked, the admin password is "EternalFriendship"
Oh how lovely for a criminal
@#PLAYERNAME# Captain, we analyzed that netcfgx.dll you've sent now, and that's it, he is living in the north part of city, enforcers are on their way already
Nice job everyone!
If I remember correctly, we supposed to have a conference with the FBI representatives
That's right sir!
But we still have an unfinished business with that second hacker - Repulse
He didn't participate is the attack, but still a partaker of a crime
Of course we could move on to the conference and leave him be, most probably guys from enforcer team will get everything about him from Daedra's place
But this is your call, Captain
So what should we do, boss?
@#PLAYERNAME# Captain, I attatched a report of what we have on Repulse to the Mission Hub, if you are still interested
